Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).

@ijuma Can you take a look? Thank you...

This is a hack to improve diagnostics on the client-side without adding full-fledged protocol changes in Kafka around SASL authentication. I am also blacking out nodes to which authentication failed, though I haven't changed any of the logic around timeout in the producer or unlimited blocking in the consumer (there is a JIRA open for the latter).

Here is an example of the logs from the console producer run with the wrong password:
```
[kafka-producer-network-thread | console-producer] TRACE Found least loaded node localhost:9092 (id: -1 rack: null) (org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient:448)
[kafka-producer-network-thread | console-producer] WARN Authentication failed for connection with localhost/127.0.0.1; closing connection (org.apache.kafka.common.network.Selector:379)
org.apache.kafka.common.errors.AuthenticationException: Authentication of client using SASL failed.
[kafka-producer-network-thread | console-producer] DEBUG Node -1 disconnected. (org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient:575)
[kafka-producer-network-thread | console-producer] DEBUG Node -1 authentication failed. (org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient:579)
[kafka-producer-network-thread | console-producer] DEBUG Give up sending metadata request since authentication failed to all nodes (org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient:686)
[kafka-producer-network-thread | console-producer] DEBUG Give up sending metadata request since authentication failed to all nodes (org.apache.kafka.clients.NetworkClient:686)
...
[main] DEBUG Exception occurred during message send: (org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.KafkaProducer:488)
org.apache.kafka.common.errors.TimeoutException: Failed to update metadata after 60000 ms.
```

@guozhangwang @Aegeaner I am not sure if we can simply change the method signature to be `validateValue(Field field, Object value)`. Suppose `schema.type` is `ARRAY` and `validateValue(...)` calls itself recursively, what should be the value of field? What if `schema.type` is `MAP`? Maybe we should just add a method with signature `validateValue(String name, Schema schema, Object value)`. The code change would be much smaller with this approach. The existing `validateValue(Schema schema, Object value)` can just call `validateValue(null, schema, value)` so that we don't have to touch unit tests.
@lindong28 Sounds good to me.

https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/1677/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).

> @guozhangwang I don't know if it makes sense to add streams to the consumer/producer/connect since they don't have any "common" metrics.

The embedded producer and consumer still have their metrics exposed beside streams' own metrics, right? All the metrics listed here are producer / consumer metrics, and since connect / streams have these clients embedded they should have such metrics as well.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/1677/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

> embedded producer: i think the client-id note is a detail that doesn't belong necessarily here.

Makes sense. I think we can still mention streams have embedded producer / consumer clients and their metrics can be found in the "common metrics" sub-section.

> same with thread-level metrics. We might change that in the future, so for now I list all the details further down.

My gut feeling is that "only some of them" sounds too careless to users, did we really just pick some of them randomly to be info and others be debug?

I think the test failure is unrelated:

```
java.lang.AssertionError: Heartbeat thread active after close
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.internals.ConsumerCoordinatorTest.testHeartbeatThreadClose(ConsumerCoordinatorTest.java:1425)
```

LGTM, thanks @stevenschlansker. There was 1 error which is related:
org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.internals.KStreamPeekTest.shouldObserveStreamElements 

Could you double check? Thanks.

@ijuma could you take a look at this please ? :)

@enothereska  I've done further testing of this with the settings you have suggested etc.
**Settings as they currently are in this PR**:
```
Writes/sec = 101679, Write MB/S 97, Reads/sec = 56980, Read MB/S = 54
Writes/sec = 104482, Write MB/S 100, Reads/sec = 49922, Read MB/S = 47
Writes/sec = 104652, Write MB/S 100, Reads/sec = 58885, Read MB/S = 56
Writes/sec = 105116, Write MB/S 100, Reads/sec = 55788, Read MB/S = 53
```

**Snappy Compression**
```
Writes/sec = 85989, Write MB/S 82, Reads/sec = 73267, Read MB/S = 69
Writes/sec = 88758, Write MB/S 84, Reads/sec = 42505, Read MB/S = 40
Writes/sec = 87545, Write MB/S 83, Reads/sec = 60225, Read MB/S = 57
Writes/sec = 86298, Write MB/S 82, Reads/sec = 45477, Read MB/S = 43
```

**Level Compaction**
```
Writes/sec = 63873, Write MB/S 61, Reads/sec = 84412, Read MB/S = 80
Writes/sec = 69998, Write MB/S 67, Reads/sec = 84650, Read MB/S = 80
Writes/sec = 72436, Write MB/S 69, Reads/sec = 68100, Read MB/S = 64
Writes/sec = 65296, Write MB/S 62, Reads/sec = 83869, Read MB/S = 79
```

Added `FakeSchema` does not have apache header, hence the checkstyle error:

```
scala2.12/connect/api/src/test/java/org/apache/kafka/connect/data/FakeSchema.java:1: Line does not match expected header line of '/\*\*'.
 FAILED
```
Updated this. @guozhangwang
Merged to trunk and cherry-picked to 0.10.2.
